definition: Something helpful that puts you in a better position; to put someone or something in a favourable position.
examples: Playing at home was a big advantage. (noun)
The schedule advantaged the early starters. (verb)
The magician’s trick astonished the crowd.
Her rapid progress astonished her coach.

definition: To show that something is true or correct; to make something certain.
examples: The lab confirmed the results.
Please confirm your booking by email.

definition: Far away in space or time; not friendly or close.
examples: We saw distant mountains on the horizon.
He seemed distant during the meeting.

definition: A person who starts something such as a company or school; to fail, break down, or sink (especially of a plan, project, or ship).
examples: The founders wrote the charity’s mission. (noun)
The boat began to founder in rough seas. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Founder (verb) = flounder and fail; (noun) = the one who founds.

examples: They live in a quiet hamlet near the woods.
The hamlet has one shop and a post box.

definition: A person who welcomes and entertains guests; a large number; to organise and provide the place for an event.
examples: The host greeted everyone at the door. (noun)
Our school will host the tournament. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Host = the one who holds the gathering.

definition: A feeling of doubt or worry about a future event (often used in the plural).
examples: She had misgivings about the plan.
Despite misgiving, they went ahead.

definition: To make or become very dry, especially by heat.
examples: The sun parched the fields.
After the run, my throat was parched.

extra.memory_tip: Parch = parked in the sun too long.

definition: The possibility of something happening; a view; to search for valuable minerals.
examples: The prospect of rain changed our plans. (noun)
They prospected for gold in the hills. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Prospect = look forward; or look for ore.

definition: Hard to find; in short supply.
examples: Fresh water is scarce in the desert.
In winter, berries become scarce.

definition: Having sharp judgement; clever at making good decisions.
examples: She is a shrewd negotiator.
A shrewd guess saved us time.

definition: Only; single; the bottom of a foot or shoe; a kind of flat fish.
examples: She was the sole survivor. (adjective)
There’s a hole in my shoe’s sole. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Sole = only one; or the sole of your shoe.

definition: Severe physical or mental suffering; to cause great pain or distress.
examples: The noise was a torment to the patient. (noun)
Don’t torment others with unkind jokes. (verb)

definition: Showing the usual qualities of a particular type; normal or expected.
examples: A typical school day starts at nine.
Rain is typical in April here.
